Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ticin A4 (natural AMPs; lantibiotic;  UCSS1b; bacteriocin; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide most resembles (97.6% similarity)Ticin A3. Active against the tested Gram-positive bacteria, including B. amyloliquefaciens, B. cereus, B. firmus, B. thuringiensis, B. subtilis, B. pumilus, E. faecalis, L. monocytogenes, Microbacterium, Paenibacillus, S. aureus, and S. sciuri. However, they are more active against food-borne pathogens such as B. cereus and L. monocytogenes. Chemical modifications such as dehydration are to be determined.
Literature Information.Author: Xin B, Zheng J, Xu Z, Li C, Ruan L, Peng D, Sun M.2015
Literature Information.Title: Three novel lantibiotics ticin A1, A3, and A4 have extremely stable properties and are promising food bio-preservatives.
